name: Easy Creamy Chicken Casserole
author: Kristen
summary: This easy creamy chicken casserole is my mother's recipe and a family favorite. It's one of our comfort foods and regular easy recipes to make through a busy week. Can easily be prepared in advance, then popped in the oven for a nice hot meal.  If making for the first time, add half of the sour cream and taste first. Add more if desired, tasting as you go, to reach desired flavor. Serve over cooked white rice.
ingredients: 1 sleeve buttery round crackers (such as Ritz®), crushed
salt and ground black pepper to taste
3  skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cubed
1 (24 ounce) container sour cream, or to taste
1 (26 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
directions: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix the crackers and melted butter together in a bowl; set aside
Bring water and chicken stock to a boil in a pot over high heat
Season with salt and black pepper
Reduce heat to a simmer, and cook, stirring occasionally, until chicken is no longer pink in the center, 5 to 7 minutes
Whisk together the sour cream and cream of chicken soup in a large bowl
Stir in the chicken, then transfer the mixture to a 9x13-inch baking dish
Sprinkle the cracker mixture on top
Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly, 25 to 30 minutes
